after: The Holy Week celebration, the August MÃ¡laga Fair (Feria de MÃ¡laga) and the MÃ¡laga Film Festival are the three major events held in the city.

The Holy Week of MÃ¡laga has been observed for five centuries. Processions start on Palm Sunday and continue until Easter Sunday. Images depicting scenes from the Passion are displayed on huge ornate tronos (floats or thrones), some weighing more than 5,000 kilos and carried by more than 250 members of the fraternity of Nuestra SeÃ±ora de la Esperanza. These tronos highlight the processions that go through the streets led by penitents dressed in long purple robes, often with pointed hats, followed by women in black carrying candles. Drums and trumpets play music and occasionally someone spontaneously sings a mournful saeta dedicated to the floats as they make their way slowly round the streets.
